array.text: All right, rookie. Let me go over the basics of adventuring.
While your characters remain idle in the Adventure tab, they'll encounter normal monsters and engage in Auto Battle.
You can earn EXP and Gold from Auto Battle.
We're at the Royal Castle Entrance.
This is where you can consistently earn the rewards displayed here regardless of your Auto Battle results.
By fighting further away from the Royal Castle Entrance, you can earn more EXP and Gold.
That's why it's important for you to explore distant regions in order to progress even faster!
Make use of Challenge if you want to travel to distant regions.
Your goal in Challenges is to eliminate bosses in designated zones.
You can move on to the next zone once you manage to take them down.
As you expand your adventure area, you can earn more EXP and Gold as well as materials and gear.
What? Don't believe me?
Then why not see for yourself! Challenge the boss in this zone.
You fought well! Great job!
Still, things will get rough if you have to fight that sort of monster all the time.
Things will get easier once you know your enemies!
Let's check out the info for the boss you're about to challenge in this area!
Here's where you can view boss information collected by our scouts.
Now that we know how this boss works, let's give it another go!
Next, let me introduce the Accel feature, which helps you progress more effectively on your adventure.
Tap the Accel button.
Using Accel instantly nets you the same amount of rewards equivalent to playing 2 hours worth of battles.
In addition, you'll also get a powerful attack buff for 10 minutes, so make sure to use it wisely!
I'll let you use it for free once a day.
Just note that you'll need Red Gems if you want to use Accel more than once!
Nice! Fighting the Mutant Firehide Troll should be a cinch for you.
Wait, do you see the Boss icon here?
Since the icon's changed, a new boss will appear starting from Zone 4 of the Royal Castle Entrance.
A new boss usually means a whole new level of challenge.
It might be difficult for you to take down this new boss using your previous settings.
Here's a tip for defeating them though. Try tapping the Skill button!
This is where you can view the skills of you and your party members and adjust your settings.
Skills refer to various abilities that deal damage to monsters and heal your party members.
Make sure to explore a wide range of skills as some skills can even stun monsters or block them from casting skills!
Each time your characters perform a Basic Attack, they recover 1 MP. Once you have enough MP, skills are cast automatically.
Each character can use 4 skills in battle.
Skills are triggered based on the order displayed here in this Boss Battle, so it's important to take their types and order into consideration.
After the fourth skill is cast, the order is reset back to the first skill.
Info on boss skills is shown here. View more details by tapping the skill info icon. This is helpful when preparing for incoming attacks.
You can drag skills around to swap their order. Be sure to also check the order of the boss's skills beforehand.
Let's learn about how to swap skills! Tap the glowing area.
Here you can see the highest-level skills that you have.
Don't forget to upgrade skills at the Skill Lab to better equip yourself against even harder bosses!
Let's select a skill to swap this time. Tap the highlighted skill icon.
Tap the Swap button.
Nice! You just swapped a skill in the first slot.
Tap the 'X' button to exit the Skill Swap window.
All you need to do is tap the Save Settings button, and you're done! Easy, right?
Before you engage a boss, make sure to look over it and adjust your skills accordingly. Remember this, and your adventure is sure to go a lot smoother!
Let's dive deeper into how a battle actually works. Tap the Timeline.
The Timeline is where you can see the skill timings of bosses and your allies in greater detail!
You'll definitely gain an edge in battle if you assign your skills based on when bosses decide to use theirs!
Tap the nametags of your allies to see their damage dealt, damage received, and healing. All of this helps you better assess the situation.
Admittedly, I'm not the best at assigning skills or predicting when a boss will do one, but I'm sure you'll do just fine!
If you find that you're having trouble against bosses alone, you can recruit party members you help fight alongside you.
An adventure's not an adventure without a party! Let's tap the Party button.
This is where you can view your party info. Right now, you're the only one, but once you accept allies or join a party, you'll be able to see more info.
Let me teach you how to recruit party members or join a party!
To recruit party members, tap the Invite button.
Adventurers that you can invite to your party will be shown here.
Select specific classes for your party or set your criteria to search for specific adventurers.
You can see adventurers that apply for your party in Applicants.
Make sure to check this list often because you'll never know when you'll come across good talent!
Let me teach you how to join a party. Tap the 'X' button.
Tap the Party List tab.
This will display a list of parties you're able to join.
Parties are suggested to you based on their current progress and CP, so you should have no trouble finding one that's appropriate for your level.
Tap a party on the Party List to apply.
Some parties allow you to join automatically, but others require approval before you can join.
This information shows the party's current progress. You can compare it with your own.
When you join a party, all members their progress adjusted to the lower of the two, so keep this in mind when you form/join a new party.
That's it for parties! Now, go out there with your party and overcome whatever stands in your way!
Nice! You can now enter the Domain!
Want to see what you can do there? Let's check it out!
The Domain is where you'll find buildings that help you progress.
At first, you won't have access to every building...
But as you continue further along on your adventure, you'll eventually gain access to more of them, so make sure to keep at it!
See, isn't it a lot easier when you adjust your skills based on Element?
It's important to use different skills and change your settings,
but it's also crucial that you enhance those same skills and improve their stats.
Let me teach you how to enhance skills this time!
Follow me to the Domain!
Even if you get your hands on new skills, they might not be that effective against powerful monsters unless you enhance or fuse them.
Let me give you a quick rundown on skills. Follow me to the Skill Lab.
This is the Enhance tab. You can enhance your skills here.
Enhancing skills increases their level.
Enhancing skills boosts their effects and allows you to take on more powerful monsters!
Let's try enhancing a skill now.
Tap a skill.
Once you tap the Enhance Skill button, your enhance is complete. Easy, right?
Enhancing skills requires Skill Scrolls, Gold, and Element Skill Scrolls.
You can obtain Skill Scrolls and Gold from Auto Battle in Adventure.
Element Skill Scrolls can be found in the Ancient Fortress. It's important for you to collect them on a regular basis!
This is the Enhance tab. You can enhance your skills here.
Enhancing skills increases their level.
Enhancing skills boosts their effects and allows you to take on more powerful monsters!
Let's try enhancing a skill now.
Tap a skill.
Once you tap the Enhance Skill button, your enhance is complete. Easy, right?
Enhancing skills requires Skill Scrolls, Gold, and Element Skill Scrolls.
You can obtain Skill Scrolls and Gold from Auto Battle in Adventure.
Element Skill Scrolls can be found in the Ancient Fortress. It's important for you to collect them on a regular basis!
Did you know that skills come with a cool Inherit feature? Let's move to the Inherit tab.
This is where you can use the Inherit feature for your skills.
When you obtain a higher grade skill than one you've already enhanced,
you can pass on the enhanced skill's level to the higher grade one.
In return, the level of the enhanced skill resets to 1.
Basically, you can easily switch over to a new skill that's stronger!
I'll let you know when you're able to use this feature, so make sure to visit the Skill Lab when the time comes.
Skills can also be fused! Let's move to the Fuse tab.
You can fuse your skills in this tab.
Keep in mind that skills also need to be identical and the same element.
Let me show you how it's done.
Don't worry! I'll take you through the process step by step.
First, select a skill to fuse.
Next, select a skill to be used as material.
Tap the Fuse button to complete the process!
Fusing skills increases the grade of the target skill.
A higher grade skill is more effective and can be enhanced to higher levels.
Make sure to collect as many skills as you can to produce higher-level skills!
We're almost done! Let's learn how to reset skills.
You can reset the Enhance Level of skills here.
Once you do, you can get back every Skill Scroll and Element Skill Scroll you've used to enhance your skills.
However, Gold you've used won't be refunded, so think carefully when you decide to reset your skills.
Whew! That about wraps it up for the Skill Lab. I'm looking forward to seeing how much more powerful you get with this feature!
Now then, allow me to show you how to make your gear more powerful.
Follow me to the Refinery!
You can enhance, fuse and scrap your gear in the Refinery.
Let's learn about enhancing gear first.
Enhancing gear increases their main stats and sub stats.
Each part comes with a different stat, so be sure to check them first before enhancing!
Here's how it's done.
Select gear to enhance.
After that, all you need to do is press the Enhance button!
You'll need Iron Ores and Gold to enhance gear.
Iron Ores can be obtained from Adventure and Dungeons.
You can enhance, fuse and scrap your gear in the Refinery.
Let's learn about enhancing gear first.
Enhancing gear increases their main stats and sub stats.
Each part comes with a different stat, so be sure to check them first before enhancing!
Here's how it's done.
Select gear to enhance.
After that, all you need to do is press the Enhance button!
You'll need Iron Ores and Gold to enhance gear.
Iron Ores can be obtained from Adventure and Dungeons.
Time to learn about how to fuse gear.
You can fuse gear in the Fuse tab.
Fusing gear yields new pieces that are higher grade.
If this happens, the gear's level resets to 1, but it'll be more effective in Enhance than the grade before it.
You need two maxed-out pieces of gear that are the same grade and part to fuse them.
Fusing gear also affects their stats.
The material gear's main stats affect those of the target gear's.
The material gear's sub stats affect those of the target gear's.
Sometimes, completely different stats are applied at a rare chance, but it all depends on the material gear. Be sure to keep this in mind.
Allow me to show you the Scrap feature this time. Don't worry, it's really easy to use!
You can scrap your gear in the Scrap tab.
Scrapping a piece of gear will make it disappear.
In return, you'll receive Iron Ores based on the Enhance grade and level.
That's it for the Refinery!
Gear is at the core of an adventurer's strength. Make sure to visit the Refinery often!
You've just earned a piece of gear from the last battle! Let's learn how to equip gear.
Follow me to the Character tab!
This is where you can view your CP and all sorts of other stats.
CP increases each time you upgrade your gear, skills, and Relics. It also goes up when your stats increase.
CP is an indicator for how strong you are compared to others. Make sure to hone your skills and increase your CP to remain competitive!
Let's learn how to equip gear.
You can equip gear by tapping a gear slot.
Gear comes in six different parts, and each part needs to be evenly upgraded in order for you to gain essential stats for your adventure.
Let's equip the head piece you've just obtained.
Tap the head slot.
If you tap a gear slot, you can see the list of gear you have.
Select a piece of head gear.
Tap Equip.
See how it's equipped? Now you just need to do the same for the rest of the parts.
Make sure to visit the Character menu whenever you earn new pieces of gear!
You now have access to the Ancient Fortress.
Hurry! Let's head to the World Map!
Ancient Fortress is a World Dungeon that nets you Skill Scrolls of different Elements.
Different Elements of the fortress appear every day, so you might want to clear this dungeon on a daily basis if you want to enhance your skills!
The difficulty and rewards for the Ancient Fortress increase based on your party's level.
That means the more progress you make, the better rewards you'll get! On the contrary, bosses will be a lot tougher...
Speaking of which, why don't we try challenging the Ancient Fortress ourselves?
Looks like the U. Labyrinth has been discovered.
Let's go check it out!
You now have access to the U. Labyrinth!
It's a World Dungeon consisting of 50 floors.
You can earn more rewards by clearing deeper floors.
You can only receive your rewards once when you clear the U. Labyrinth. The U. Labyrinth also resets every 30 days.
Once it resets, you can challenge the Labyrinth again from the first floor and earn new rewards.
Basically, you're going to want to try and reach the deepest floor possible within 30 days!
Since it's available now, how about we dive right in?
You're finally outside the Royal Castle Entrance! I expected nothing less from you!
You now have access to the World Map! Let's take a look!
This is the World Map.
You can access a wide range of World Dungeons in the World Map.
For now, you can enter an Instance Dungeon.
Each time you clear an area, an Instance Dungeon is randomly generated in the area.
See this exclamation mark here?
By tapping it, you can accept a dungeon quest.
Once you accept the quest, a dungeon is generated, and a time limit will appear.
Once time is up, the dungeon will disappear, and you won't be able to access it anymore. Be sure to clear it before time runs out.
Don't worry, though. You can always just accept the next quest and enter a new dungeon!
Look here! This indicates the Danger Level of the world your party is in.
The higher the Danger Level, the higher the dungeon grade, which lets you come across better rewards and stronger monsters.
Danger Level increases each time your party clears a dungeon and decreases whenever an uncleared dungeon closes.
In other words, playing dungeons consistently is key to getting better rewards!
Let's accept a quest this time! Tap the exclamation mark on the dungeon.
Tapping the exclamation mark will show you more details about a quest.
Once you tap OK, you'll accept the quest and enter an Instance Dungeon.
Keep in mind that a quest accepted by a party member is shared with the rest of the party.
Tap OK to accept the quest!
How about we check out new dungeon that was created?
Tap the Instance Dungeon.
When you enter a dungeon, you can see its boss as well as the rewards.
See the Party Reward and Clear Reward? Here's how they work.
Clear a dungeon to instantly earn a Clear Reward.
Clear a dungeon with party members to earn the Party Reward. The Party Reward is given to everyone in the party.
That means you'll earn the most rewards when your entire party manages to clear a dungeon.
Party Rewards also include Ancient Coins. Use them to buy various items at the Ancient Shop.
Let's give it a try!
Tap Challenge to take on the Instance Dungeon.
You now have access to the Tower of Knowledge in your Domain.
All right then! I'll show you how you can obtain skills. To the Tower of Knowledge!
You can obtain skills by researching them in the Tower of Knowledge.
To research skills, you'll need Research Tickets, as well as Blue Gems or Red Gems.
Research Mileage is accrued each time you research skills, which will earn you even more rewards.
Let's try researching some skills.
Hope you end up getting some good ones!
You can obtain skills by researching them in the Tower of Knowledge.
To research skills, you'll need Research Tickets, as well as Blue Gems or Red Gems.
Research Mileage is accrued each time you research skills, which will earn you even more rewards.
Let's try researching some skills.
Hope you end up getting some good ones!
You can now enter the Archeology Lab.
This is where all sorts of archeologists support you on your adventure. Let's head inside.
In the Archeology Lab, you can go on an Exploration, research Reliquaries, or upgrade Relics.
I'll start by going over Exploration.
This is the list of available Explorations.
After you begin an Exploration, you can earn the rewards on the left after a certain amount of time.
If you're in a hurry, you can use Gems to instantly complete an Exploration you're on!
Normally, Explorations take a while to complete, but I'll let you complete one right away this time.
Wanna see how it works?
Tap the Explore button.
Exploration is complete! Let's go ahead and claim our rewards!
You've just earned a reward for completing an Exploration!
Whenever you complete an Exploration, you can go on another right after.
I'll show you how to increase your slots so you can do more Explorations.
Check it out. Your Exploration Level and the number of archeologists currently exploring are displayed.
You can increase your Exploration Level by earning EXP each time you complete an Exploration.
A higher level means you can go on more Explorations.
That's it for Exploration! Let's take a look at the Research feature.
In the Research tab, you can research Reliquaries you earn from Exploration.
Researching Reliquaries nets you Relics!
I'll tell you more about the Relics in the Upgrade tab. Let's head on over there.
Relics are imbued with special abilities and used alongside skills.
Once you set them up with skills, they are used automatically when skills are triggered, similar to passive skills.
Each Relic comes with a unique ability.
How about we try upgrading a Relic? Tap the Relic.
To upgrade a Relic, you'll need an identical one that's the same grade.
Once you collect sufficient Relics for a given grade, you can proceed by tapping Upgrade.
As it just so happens, we have two [R] Relics. Let's upgrade them right away!
You've just earned an [R+] Relic!
Upgrading a Relic increases its grade and stats.
You can obtain Relics from Exploration.
Whew, the Archeology Lab is full of all sorts of neat things, huh. Shall we head back into the fray then?
In the Archeology Lab, you can go on an Exploration, research Reliquaries, or upgrade Relics.
I'll start by going over Exploration.
This is the list of available Explorations.
After you begin an Exploration, you can earn the rewards on the left after a certain amount of time.
If you're in a hurry, you can use Gems to instantly complete an Exploration you're on!
Normally, Explorations take a while to complete, but I'll let you complete one right away this time.
Wanna see how it works?
Tap the Exploration button.
Exploration is complete! Let's go ahead and claim our rewards!
You've just earned a reward for completing an Exploration!
Whenever you complete an Exploration, you can go on another right after.
I'll show you how to increase your slots so you can do more Explorations.
Check it out. Your Exploration Level and the number of archeologists currently exploring are displayed.
You can increase your Exploration Level by earning EXP each time you complete an Exploration.
A higher level means you can go on more Explorations.
That's it for Exploration! Let's take a look at the Research feature.
In the Research tab, you can research Reliquaries you earn from Exploration.
Researching Reliquaries nets you Relics!
I'll tell you more about the Relics in the Upgrade tab. Let's head on over there.
Relics are imbued with special abilities and used alongside skills.
Once you set them up with skills, they are used automatically when skills are triggered, similar to passive skills.
Each Relic comes with a unique ability.
Upgrading a Relic increases its grade and stats.
You can obtain Relics from Exploration.
Whew, the Archeology Lab is full of all sorts of neat things, huh. Shall we head back into the fray then?
Welcome! You must be a first-time customer here!
The Shop consists of the General Shop, Black Market, and Ancient Shop.
The General Shop allows you to buy common items using Gold and Blue Gems.
You can buy rare items using Blue Gems and Red Gems in the Black Market.
The Ancient Shop only deals with extremely rare items of the highest grade.
That's why, in order to buy them, you'll need Ancient Coins.
You already know how to earn Ancient Coins, right? You can earn them by clearing dungeons with your party members.
That's it for the Shop!
You know, I kinda feel like doing some shopping myself! See you later!
Since you're in the Domain, let me explain what the Adventurer Alliance is.
This is the Adventurer Alliance. It's an important place for every new adventurer.
Tap Adventurer Alliance.
Welcome to the Adventurer Alliance!
Did you forget? You're already a member!
You'll be in the Adventurer Alliance League for the first 15 days.
After that, you can officially join the Adventurer Alliance and go exploring with any adventurer in the Rohan Kingdom.
Every 5 days, the Adventurer Alliance League selects the best adventurer and provides a reward.
As for how to win... They choose the adventurer who has the highest progress.
So keep a trying for a chance to win! Oh, don't forget my share when you win. After all, it'll be all thanks to my advice!
Let's learn how to equip Relics earned from the Archeology Lab.
Remember how you can use Relics alongside skills? Tap the Skill button.
You can equip Relics by tapping the highlighted area here. Let's give it a try.
Once you equip a Relic, it's automatically used when the skill in the first slot is triggered.
Let's equip one now. Tap a Relic slot.
Equipping Relics works the same way as skills.
Tap a Relic.
Then hit Equip. Voila! Wasn't that easy?
Don't forget to tap Save Settings to save everything!
Tap the X button.
All you need to do is tap the Save Settings button, and you're done! Easy, right?
It's important to pair the right Relics with your skills.
Okay then, make sure you've got the right Relics on before you go fight powerful monsters!
Let's learn how to equip Relics earned from the Archeology Lab.
Remember how you can use Relics alongside skills? Tap the Skill button.
You can equip Relics by tapping the highlighted area here. Let's give it a try.
Once you equip a Relic, it's automatically used when the skill in the first slot is triggered.
Let's equip one now. Tap a Relic slot.
Equipping Relics works the same way as skills.
Tap a Relic.
Then hit Equip. Voila! Wasn't that easy?
Don't forget to tap Save Settings to save everything!
Tap the X button.
All you need to do is tap the Save Settings button, and you're done! Easy, right?
It's important to pair the right Relics with your skills.
Okay then, make sure you've got the right Relics on before you go fight powerful monsters!
Congratulations on successfully finishing the Adventurer Alliance League!
You're now an official member of the Adventurer Alliance. Welcome to the team!
The Adventurer Alliance recognizes the best adventurer in each field and rewards them accordingly.
Adventurer Rank is a contest to see which adventurer has the highest progress.
Fighter Rank is a contest to see which adventurer has the highest CP.
Tactician Rank is a contest to see which adventurer is the highest level and has the highest dungeon cleared in terms of grade.
Collector Rank is a contest to see which adventurer has the most varied and highest-grade gear, skills, and Relics collected.
You can only receive a Rank Reward once when you reach a respective rank.
That's it for the Adventurer Alliance. Looking forward to your success in the days to come!
Now that you've equipped new pieces of gear, you can deal with stronger monsters.
Go to the Adventure tab and see how far you can go in Challenge!
Once you make it through this challenge, you'll be able to access Royal Castle Entrance: Zone 4.
Tap the Challenge button to engage in battle!
Okay then, let's test if the skills you've swapped in work on this boss!
Let's tap the Challenge button!
Hey, looks like you've made quite a progress.
Guess it's time to show you what Talent Passives are. Follow me to the Character menu.
You now have access to Talent Passives!
Curious about how they work? Allow me to show you. Tap the Talent button.
You can freely boost your stats using Normal Talent Points in the Talent tab.
The three icons here show which stats you can boost at the moment.
Choose your stats wisely since this will determine your overall stat distribution.
Once you've selected the stats you want, tap Learn to get started.
Normal Talent Points are then used to obtain the stats you've selected.
The stats you choose will ultimately determine how your characters ends up.
These points are given each time you level up or advance your characters. Make sure to put them to good use.
Let's move on to Advancement this time! Tap the Advance tap to proceed.
When you meet the Advancement Requirements, you can advance to a class of a higher grade.
You get Normal Talent Points and Special Talent Points.
Also, as I mentioned previously, Normal Talent Points allow you to increase your stats.
Special Talent Points allow you to obtain special Continuous Effects.
You need to fulfill Requirements in order to advance.
Then you can earn the Advancement Rewards shown here.
You can advance your characters every 10 levels. A special Advancement is enabled every 50 levels.
Special Advancements may be quite tricky, but it changes your character's appearance drastically.
Don't forget to advance your characters if you want to become stronger!
I wonder what kind of buildings we'll come across in the next zone?
Now then, on to the boss battle!
With your enhanced skills, you'll have a much easier time taking down tougher monsters.
Tap Challenge to move on to the next zone!
Looks like you're a bonafide challenger now!
All right then! Let's hurry and take out the boss here!
You can obtain skills by researching them in the Tower of Knowledge.
To research skills, you'll need Research Tickets, as well as Blue Gems or Red Gems.
Research Mileage is accrued each time you research skills, which will earn you even more rewards.
Let's research skills this time.
Hope you end up getting some good ones!
Nice! An [R+] grade dungeon has opened for the first time!
The chance to spawn dungeons of a higher grade increases as your party's Danger Level increases.
Your party's Danger Level increases whenever you clear dungeons of a higher grade.
Sometimes you'll run into a [UR] grade dungeon as you clear dungeons consistently.
[UR] dungeons net you [UR] grade rewards, so keep at it until you get everything you need!
All right, let's keep going!
Congratulations! You got a new party member!
It's time for you to learn how to adjust Skill Settings along with your party members.
Tap the Skill button.
See the nicknames of your party members?
When you tap a nickname, you can adjust the Skill Settings for that party member.
Allow me to demonstrate. Tap a party member's nickname.
You can swap the skills of your party members here.
It's the same as how you would swap your own skills.
You can drag skills around to swap their order.
You can also tap a skill to swap it with another.
Make sure to hit Save Settings so that they take effect the next time you battle!
But keep in mind that you won't see these changes in your current battle, but in future ones instead.
Congratulations! You got a new party member!
It's time for you to learn how to adjust Skill Settings along with your party members.
Tap the Skill button.
See the nicknames of your party members?
When you tap a nickname, you can adjust the Skill Settings for that party member.
Allow me to demonstrate. Tap a party member's nickname.
You can swap the skills of your party members here.
It's the same as how you would swap your own skills.
You can drag skills around to swap their order.
You can also tap a skill to swap it with another.
Make sure to hit Save Settings so that they take effect the next time you battle!
But keep in mind that you won't see these changes in your current battle, but in future ones instead.
Congratulations! You got a new party member!
It's time for you to learn how to adjust Skill Settings along with your party members.
Tap the Skill button.
See the nicknames of your party members?
When you tap a nickname, you can adjust the Skill Settings for that party member.
Allow me to demonstrate. Tap a party member's nickname.
You can swap the skills of your party members here.
It's the same as how you would swap your own skills.
You can drag skills around to swap their order.
You can also tap a skill to swap it with another.
Make sure to hit Save Settings so that they take effect the next time you battle!
But keep in mind that you won't see these changes in your current battle, but in future ones instead.
By the way, are you making use of Presets?
It allows you to swap to different Skill Settings more easily when you fight against bosses.
See for yourself! Tap the Skill button.
This button is also available in the Skill Settings menu when you're in dungeons or the Auto Battle Settings menu.
Tap Preset.
Presets allows you to save your settings for skills and Relics so that you can use them again in the future.
You can also save Presets for your party members as well.
The skills and Relics shown here are the ones saved in Preset 1.
Your initial Preset has the very first skills given to you by the Adventurer Alliance.
I'll show you how to save a Preset.
Let's try saving your current skills and Relics to Preset 1.
Tapping the Save Preset button will save your current skill and Relic settings to the Preset.
If you want to use the Preset you just saved,
you need to tap the Load Preset button here.
You can have multiple Presets, so it'll make your life much easier if you create and save the best settings for each boss.
Looks like your dungeon grade is a lot higher than before. This means you'll face tougher monsters moving forward.
Skill Settings might not have played a huge factor until now, but you really need to pay attention to them when you battle bosses.
Skill Settings for dungeons can be changed here.
Tap Skill Settings.
The Skill Settings saved here only take effect in Ancient Fortress, U. Labyrinth, and Instance Dungeons.
Each dungeon requires a different strategy. That's why it's a good idea to use your Presets!
Don't forget to hit Save Settings after you're done adjusting your settings!
Did you know that monsters and skills have an Efficacy relationship?
Tap the Element button.
There are six Elements in all: Fire, Ice, Earth, Lightning, Holy, and Dark.
The four Elements, Fire, Ice, Earth, and Lightning, share Efficacy relationships with only each other.
The same goes for Holy and Dark.
Let me explain how it works. For example, if you attack Lightning monsters using Fire skills, you can deal more damage.
However, you'll deal less damage if you attack Lightning monsters using Earth skills.
All attack and defense skills you use are affected by the Elements.
Make sure to take the Elements of your skills into consideration against certain monsters to gain the upper hand in battle!
You can obtain gear by spending currencies in the Forge.
You need Iron Ores for [R] Gear, Mithril for [SR] Gear, and Soul Stones for [SSR] Gear.
Each grade requires different currencies.
But you can't keep producing gear just because you have lots of Iron Ores.
There's a limit to the pieces of gear you can make for a week.
Keep in mind that this limit is reset every Monday.
Crafting gear is a piece of cake!
You can proceed by tapping the button shown here.
Don't forget to bring the necessary amount of currencies!
Although grades of gear are fixed, parts are randomly determined.
Here's 100 Iron Ores to get you started. Try crafting gear on your own!
You now have access to the Forge!
Let's take a closer look! Tap Forge.
You can obtain gear by spending currencies in the Forge.
You need Iron Ores for [R] Gear, Mithril for [SR] Gear, and Soul Stones for [SSR] Gear.
But you can't keep producing gear just because you have lots of Iron Ores.
There's a limit to the pieces of gear you can make for a week.
Keep in mind that this limit is reset every Monday.
Crafting gear is a piece of cake!
You can proceed by tapping the button shown here.
Don't forget to bring the necessary amount of currencies!
Although grades of gear are fixed, parts are randomly determined.
Here's 100 Iron Ores to get you started. Try crafting gear on your own!
You can obtain gear by spending currencies in the Forge.

You can proceed by tapping the button shown here.

Here's 100 Iron Ores to get you started. Try crafting gear on your own!
You fought well! Great job!
You can check the current zone you're exploring here.
Awesome! You just made it to Royal Castle Entrance: Zone 2!
You can move on to the next zone after each successful challenge.
Royal Castle Entrance is made up of 10 zones.
When you clear Royal Castle Entrance: Zone 10, you can move on to the next area.
If you're unsure of what to do, reaching the next area outside the Royal Castle Entrance seems like a realistic goal, wouldn't you say?
I'm sure you'll reach the next area in no time.
Okay then, tap the Challenge button to proceed!
You now have access to the Forge!
The Forge is where you can obtain gear. How about we go check it out?
Let's tap Domain.
The monsters in this zone look really tough.
You might need to get your hands on more skills.
Sounds like it's a good time to research skills at the Tower of Knowledge.
Follow me to Domain.
If you want to use any new skills in boss battles, be sure to swap out your skills before you hit the Challenge button.
Let's change our battle settings using the skill you just obtained. Tap Skill.
Tap on the skill you wish to swap out.
Let's try equipping the skill with the highest grade!
Tap a skill.
Tap the Swap button.
Looks like you're all set!
Tap the 'X' button to exit the Skill Swap window.
Make sure to tap Save Settings before you're done.
Great, you managed to swap out your skills. Now, let's put them to good use!
If you want to use any new skills in boss battles, be sure to swap out your skills before you hit the Challenge button.
Let's change our battle settings using the skill you just obtained. Tap Skill.
Tap on the skill you wish to swap out.
Let's try equipping the skill with the highest grade!
Tap a skill.
Tap the Swap button.
Looks like you're all set!
Tap the 'X' button to exit the Skill Swap window.
Make sure to tap Save Settings before you're done.
Great, you managed to swap out your skills. Now, let's put them to good use!
You're already halfway done with the Royal Castle Entrance!
Tap Challenge to engage in battle!
Did you manage to find some party members?
If any one of your party members taps Challenge, the whole party will proceed to take on the boss.
Hope you end up finding reliable people to join your party!
For now, though, try taking on Challenges by yourself.
Did you manage to find some party members?
If any one of your party members taps Challenge, the whole party will proceed to take on the boss.
Hope you end up finding reliable people to join your party!
For now, though, try taking on Challenges by yourself.
You may come across many different World Dungeons as you explore more of the Goblin Base.
I heard the Archeology Lab opened up in the Domain. Make sure to visit the Domain later!
But first, let's focus our attention on this Challenge!
I'll show you how to use the Beginner's Gift you just got.
Here's the Vault. This is where you'll find the items you’ve obtained from your adventure.
Tap Vault.
The Vault is where items from your adventure are stored.
Let's open the Beginner's Gift we just got.
Tap Beginner's Gift.
I wonder what's inside!
Nice! You ended up getting all sorts of rewards!
This is how you use items in the Vault.
Make sure to visit the Vault often whenever you find new items.
Okay then, let's press on with your adventure.
Nice! Fighting the Venomtail Manticore should be a cinch for you.
Wait, do you see the Boss icon here?
Since the icon's changed, a boss of a new Element will appear starting from Zone 6 of the Royal Castle Entrance.
A new Element usually means a whole new type of challenge.
Huh? What are Elements, you ask?
Oops... Did I forget to explain them to you?
Here's a tip for defeating bosses of various Elements.
Tap the Skill button.
This is where you can view the skills of you and your party members and adjust your settings.
Each character can use 4 skills in one battle.
Skills are triggered based on the order displayed in Skill Settings, so it's important to consider their types and order.
After the fourth skill is cast, the order is reset back to the first skill.
You can drag skills around to swap their order.
Info on boss skills is shown here. View more details by tapping the skill info icon. This is helpful when preparing for incoming attacks.
All right, let me explain what Elements are. Pay attention because this is important.
Tap the Element button.
There are six Elements in all: Fire, Ice, Earth, Lightning, Holy, and Dark.
The four Elements, Fire, Ice, Earth, and Lightning, share Efficacy relationships with only each other.
The same goes for Holy and Dark.
Let me explain how it works. For example, if you attack Lightning monsters using Fire skills, you can deal more damage.
However, you'll deal less damage if you attack Lightning monsters using Earth skills.
All attack and defense skills you use are affected by the Elements.
Make sure to check the Elements of your skills against certain monsters to gain the upper hand in battle!
That's it for Elements!
Let me demonstrate all of this in a real battle.
Tap the X button.
Let's swap in Fire skills to counter the Lightning boss! Tap the glowing area.
Here you can see the highest-level skills that you have.
Let's select a skill to swap out.
Tap the Skill icon that's displayed.
Tap the Swap button.
Nice! You managed to change the skill in the first slot.
Tap the 'X' button to exit the Skill Swap window.
All you need to do is tap the Save Settings button, and you're done! Easy, right?
Before you engage a boss, make sure to look over it and adjust your skills accordingly. Remember this, and your adventure is sure to go a lot smoother!
You've made it all the way to Royal Castle Entrance: Zone 10!
But this isn't the end! The real adventure starts now!
We're about to head to the Goblin Base.
Once we're there, you'll see monsters you've never encountered before.
But a new area also means a ton of brand-new activities!
For example, you'll be able to enter dungeons, access the Archeology Lab, and more.
Of course, I'll be with you every step of the way, so don't you worry about a thing!
Now then, let's keep on challenging bosses!
You can take part in lots of other activities in the Domain.
Let's move on to the next zone and gain access to other buildings!
Hi! I'm Sarah.
I'm a guide for new adventurers who've joined the Adventurer Alliance.
I'm sure you have many questions about this place.
Fear not! I'm here to walk you through everything!
First, let me teach you the basics of battle.
Look! A goblin is closing in on you.
Let's get going.
All right, let's go!
Shall we begin?
I'm excited to see what kinds of adventures await us!
Look, it's a Goblin.
A Goblin!
A Goblin!
It's a Goblin!
Let's take it out!
All battles will progress automatically.
Watch closely how the battle progresses!
Your MP is filled each time you land a Basic Attack.
You need MP to use skills.
This water drop mark indicates the MP cost for this skill.
You earn 1 MP from a Basic Attack.
Let's perform another Basic Attack to gain MP.
Great! Now you have enough MP to use a skill.
Let's use it to defeat the Goblin!
That was an easy feat.
I wonder if there are any stronger enemies around.
That was hardly a challenge.
We did it!
Sure, we managed to defeat that Goblin.
But we're about to reach the Troll's territory.
The Troll is a powerful boss inhabiting this area.
It'll be hard for you to deal with the Troll by yourself.
So it's a good idea to form a party with mercenaries from the Adventurer Alliance.
My shield will protect you.
Thank you.
I'll take them all down in a flash.
Thank you.
Tell me who you need eliminated.
Thank you.
Don't worry. I'll support you.
Thank you.
A party consists of Tank, DPS, and Healer characters.
These mercenaries will help you on your adventure until you come across party members of your own.
Let's see how far your adventure will take you!
Look! It's a Troll!
You'll need to get past it to reach the next zone.
In this battle, I'll explain how you can defeat bosses like this one as a party.
Each party member has a role.
Knight protects his allies against boss attacks.
Druid heals injured allies or provides buffs to the party.
Rogue and Mage unleash powerful attacks to incapacitate enemies.
Got all that? Good. Let's take down that ugly Troll!
Dangerous attack incoming. Allow me to shield you.
The monster's about to use a skill!
Luckily, the Knight used a defense skill to lessen the blow.
Let me heal you.
Thank you.
My pleasure.
It's my turn now!
Let me finish it off!
Good job! You defeated the Troll!
As long as you and your party members work together, you can take on any monster that stands in your way!
It's time for us to leave the Royal Castle Entrance!
Now's where the real adventure begins!
Nice! An [SR] grade Instance Dungeon has just spawned!
This Instance Dungeon will be a lot tougher,
because starting from [SR] grade, Affixes will come into play.
An Affix is a buff that makes bosses stronger.
As grade increases, the number of Affixes also increases.
You'll need to take boss patterns AND Affixes into account when you adjust your skill settings.
But based on your progress so far, I know you've got this!
A Mithril Mine has been discovered in Vangor Fields!
Let's go check it out!
Normally, an Instance Dungeon spawns after you clear an entire area.
But sometimes a Mithril Mine will spawn like this.
After you clear a Mithril Mine, you can enter it again after 8 hours.
So it's a good idea to expand more areas so you can challenge Mithril Mines more often!
Challenging Mithril Mines nets you Mithril.
It's a rare resource used for crafting [SR] gear or buying items at the Black Market.
Wanna get stronger? Then make sure to visit Mithril Mines!
I've got more info for you regarding Mithril Mines. Follow me.
Although Instance Dungeons have fixed grades,
you can select a grade when you enter a Mithril Mine.
For now, you can only enter an [R] grade mine.
After you clear the [R] grade mine, you can enter one that's [R+] grade.
Let's enter an [R] grade mine this time.
Tap the Select button.
You also fight alongside your party members in a Mithril Mine.
It won't be as much difficult since you can select a difficulty.
By the way, keep in mind that you can only collect 1,000 Mithril per week.
Shall we challenge the Mithril Mine now?
Tap Challenge to enter!
If you manage to make it through this challenge, you can access Royal Castle Entrance: Zone 10.
Tap Challenge to start!
Skills can also be fused! Let's move to the Fuse tab.
You can fuse your skills in this tab.
Keep in mind that skills also need to be identical and the same element.
Let me show you how it's done.
Don't worry! I'll take you through the process step by step.
Tap the first slot to select a skill to fuse.
Next, select a skill to be used as material.
Tap Fuse.
Fusing skills increases the grade of the target skill.
A higher grade skill is more effective and can be enhanced to higher levels.
Tap the Fuse button to complete the process!
Make sure to collect as many skills as you can to produce higher-level skills!
We're almost done! Let's learn how to reset skills.
You can reset the Enhance Level of skills here.
Once you do, you can get back every Skill Scroll and Element Skill Scroll you've used to enhance your skills.
However, Gold you've used won't be refunded, so think carefully when you decide to reset your skills.
Whew! That about wraps it up for the Skill Lab. I'm looking forward to seeing how much more powerful you get with this feature!
Time to learn about how to fuse gear.
You can fuse gear in the Fuse tab.
You need two maxed-out pieces of gear that are the same grade and part to fuse them.
How about we try crafting some gear?
Tap the first slot to select the first Fusion material.
Tap the second slot to select another material.
Tap the Fuse button to complete the process!
If this happens, the gear's level resets to 1, but it'll be more effective in Enhance than the grade before it.
The material gear's main stats affect those of the target gear's.
The material gear's sub stats affect those of the target gear's.
Sometimes, completely different stats are applied at a rare chance, but it all depends on the material gear. Be sure to keep this in mind.
Allow me to show you the Scrap feature this time. Don't worry, it's really easy to use!
You can scrap your gear in the Scrap tab.
Scrapping a piece of gear will make it disappear.
In return, you'll receive Iron Ores based on the Enhance grade and level.
That's it for the Refinery!
Gear is at the core of an adventurer's strength. Make sure to visit the Refinery often!
Refinery is now accessible!
Let's go check it out!
Let's tap Domain.
